thread.title: Experts pour cold water on Olympic athletes’ fondness for ice baths | Irish Independent
thread.title_full: Experts pour cold water on Olympic athletes’ fondness for ice baths | Irish Independent

author: Eilish O'Regan
title: Experts pour cold water on Olympic athletes’ fondness for ice baths | Irish Independent
text:
Home > Irish News Experts pour cold water on Olympic athletes’ fondness for ice baths
Many athletes believe ice baths aid their recovery. Photo: Getty
Eilish O'Regan Today at 03:30
Athletes at the Olympic games are set to immerse themselves in around €2.5m worth of ice baths or packs to relieve their tired muscles – but questions hang over how effective it is, while it is also bad for the planet, experts warn today.
Cryotherapy – ice treatment – in the form of ice packs, compression pumps, ice baths and cold-water immersion is widely used by athletes and support teams to manage injury and illness, and speed up recovery, said authors from Montpellier University, in the British Journal of Sports Medicine .
